unnormalised: Hey Earth Lovers! Ever wonder where all that kachra from your Diwali sweets and Ganpati celebrations ends up? Waste Management is a HUGE deal, especially here in India.
normalised: Hey Earth Lovers! Ever wonder where all that kachra from your Diwali sweets and Ganpati celebrations ends up? Waste Management is a huge deal, especially here in India.

unnormalised: News coming in from the IIT Delhi guys, they're working on some cool tech to convert agri-waste - you know, all that leftover stubble from the fields in Punjab - into bio-fuel. Pretty neat, right? Imagine our 'lal batti' cars running on something other than petrol.
normalised: News coming in from the I I T Delhi guys, they are working on some cool tech to convert agri-waste - you know, all that leftover stubble from the fields in Punjab - into bio-fuel. Pretty neat, right? Imagine our 'lal batti' cars running on something other than petrol.

unnormalised: Speaking of cleaning up, remember that scene in 'Swades' where SRK tries to fix the village's electricity problem? Well, a lot of villages are facing similar challenges with waste disposal. But the good news is, initiatives are popping up everywhere.
normalised: Speaking of cleaning up, remember that scene in 'Swades' where S R K tries to fix the village's electricity problem? Well, a lot of villages are facing similar challenges with waste disposal. But the good news is, initiatives are popping up everywhere.

unnormalised: From composting kitchen waste in Mumbai flats to innovative recycling programs in Chennai schools, folks are getting creative. The govt. is also pushing for better infrastructure and awareness campaigns. Let's all do our bit, even if it's just segregating our waste. Every little helps, ya? Let's make India 'Swachh Bharat' for real, and not just in slogans!
normalised: From composting kitchen waste in Mumbai flats to innovative recycling programs in Chennai schools, folks are getting creative. The government is also pushing for better infrastructure and awareness campaigns. Let us all do our bit, even if it is just segregating our waste. Every little helps, ya? Let us make India 'Swachh Bharat' for real, and not just in slogans!
